summary: The document is a secret FBI memo dated March 13, 1963, from Director John Edgar Hoover to the CIA's Deputy Director of Plans, concerning Angela Prince Moutsos. It references prior communications about Moutsos and requests information on her continued residence in Cuba and any activities there. The memo is part of the JFK Assassination Records and was reviewed under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
key_findings: The document is a communication between the FBI and CIA regarding Angela Prince Moutsos.
It seeks information on Moutsos's residence and activities in Cuba.
The memo is classified as 'Secret' and has restrictions, indicating its sensitive nature.
It is part of the JFK Assassination Records, suggesting a possible connection to broader investigations or interests related to the assassination.
